TopicTitle: Foot like crater on the Mun?

Articles.Content:
I found a foot like crater on the mun, I asked one of my friends that is more into KSP than me and he said I should post it on here.

What do you guys think
What coordinates? I gotta bring a ball of structural panels and place it in the foot crater. I'll call it a "foot-ball".
Maybe paraedolia in this case, if it has 4 or 5 toes is not really clear and the feet profile seems not correct. I would say this is just a joke the light is doing to you!

Sounds like we need to do some investigating, for science..

Are there any others like it nearby?

Maybe paraedolia in this case, if it has 4 or 5 toes is not really clear and the feet profile seems not correct. I would say this is just a joke the light is doing to you!

Similar to the face mountain on Mars. The face went away with higher resolution images though, as the lighting glitches were resolved.

What coordinates? I gotta bring a ball of structural panels and place it in the foot crater. I'll call it a "foot-ball".

Ok, I don't want to take a, what you call, 'Foot-Ball' to the munar-foot, but I do want to send a rover to investigate
one time I found a kidney shaped crater with a canyon
It was left by the Kraken, you were lucky it did not eat your ship!
I think it was implemented by the devs as a reference to Neil Armstrong's footprint on the moon. I remember reading about it somewhere...
Are the graphic details maximized? Might be just because of inferior rendering. Those "toes" don't look like shadows.
